description: The classic formation. Solid all-round structure with width in midfield and a strike partnership.
Three forwards terrorize defenses while a midfield trio controls the tempo.
A double pivot shields the defense while a creative number 10 runs the show.
Wing-back domination. Five across the middle creates overloads with two strikers central.
Defensive solidity with counter-attacking potential. Wing-backs provide the only width.
A deep-lying midfielder screens the back four. Four runners ahead transition play rapidly.
All-out attack with three forwards backed by four energetic midfielders. High risk, high reward.
Four forwards! An audacious setup that overwhelms opponents with sheer attacking firepower.
A trequartista behind two strikers creates unpredictable passing patterns in the final third.
The Diamond. A narrow midfield shape that dominates centrally with creative overloads.
Tactical insanity. Just three defenders — total commitment to attack. Dominate or be destroyed.
Five forwards! The ultimate attacking formation. Score more than you concede — if you can.
The fortress. Five defenders and a compact midfield make this near-impossible to break down.
Midfield dominance with five across the middle. A lone striker holds up play for runners.
Park the bus. Six defenders create an impenetrable wall with minimal attacking commitment.
Five at the back with three forwards. A hybrid of solid defense and rapid counter-attacks.
Ultra-compact with a lone anchor. Wing-backs push high while center-backs hold the line.
Designed for total control. Two pivots and four attacking midfielders suffocate opposition.
The Christmas Tree. Two trequartistas behind a lone striker create beautiful passing triangles.
A single pivot allows two creative midfielders to dictate play with three mobile forwards.
A regista controls from deep while four midfielders create rotational passing networks.

name: 4-4-2 (Flat)
description: Classic shape that absorbs pressure centrally and releases via rapid wing transitions.
Wing-backs push high on transition while two shadow strikers float behind a target man.
A split striker pair — one drops deep, one stays high on the shoulder for quick breaks.

name: 5-3-2 (Counter)
description: Rock-solid defense with two speedy forwards ready to exploit space on the break.

name: 4-3-3 (Wide)
description: Wide forwards hug the sideline creating 1v1 situations for direct wingers and overlapping fullbacks.

name: 3-4-3 (Wing)
description: Wing-backs and wide forwards stretch the pitch to its maximum width.

name: 4-2-4 (Cross)
description: Two wide forwards + two central strikers create constant crossing opportunities.

name: 4-1-2-1-2 (Narrow)
description: The narrow diamond. Attack through the middle with creative central overloads.

name: 4-3-1-2 (Central)
description: A number 10 links midfield to attack in tight central spaces. Perfect for playmakers.

name: 3-5-2 (Narrow)
description: Five midfielders dominate the center. Wing-backs tuck in to create numerical superiority.
Two defenders? Absolute madness. A chaotic setup for the truly adventurous manager.
One lonely defender. Five forwards. Utter mayhem. Not recommended for competitive play.
SIX forwards. A hattrick of insanity. Your defense is a suggestion, not a priority.
One midfielder connects three defenders to six forwards. Football reimagined — or ruined.
